items.title: New organelled discovered in parasitic wasp venom
items.summary: Biologists have identified the composition of 'virus-like particles' (VLPs) found in the venom of a wasp that is a parasite of fruit flies. Invisible to the eye, wasp VLPs suppress the flies' immune responses by killing their blood cells.

alternate.title: New organelled discovered in parasitic wasp venom

thumbnail.title: New organelled discovered in parasitic wasp venom

items.title: Girl soccer players five times more likely than boys to return to play same day after concussion
items.summary: A new study found girls were significantly more likely than boys to return to play the same day following a soccer-related concussion, placing them at risk for more significant injury. More than half of girls in the study resumed playing in a game or practice the same day as their injury, compared to just 17 percent of boys.

alternate.title: Girl soccer players five times more likely than boys to return to play same day after concussion

items.title: Common surgeries may serve as pathway to nonmedical opioid use in adolescents
items.summary: Results of study, the first known to suggest long-term opioid use after surgery may be a significant problem for teens and young adults, shows youth patients commonly fill post-surgical painkiller prescriptions for months beyond typical recovery times.

alternate.title: Common surgeries may serve as pathway to nonmedical opioid use in adolescents

items.title: 300,000 families living in US-Mexico border towns face exposure to toxic stress
items.summary: Roughly 300,000 Texans living in impoverished border communities known as 'colonias' are facing substandard housing, lack of resources and exposure to toxic stress. New research finds these communities are also ill-equipped to face a natural disaster.

alternate.title: 300,000 families living in US-Mexico border towns face exposure to toxic stress

items.title: Need for epinephrine in schools -- and staff trained to administer it
items.summary: With school nurses often covering multiple buildings, researchers find that nearly one in five students who experience severe allergic reactions are given potentially life-saving epinephrine injections from unlicensed staff or students.

alternate.title: Need for epinephrine in schools -- and staff trained to administer it

items.title: Green schoolyards offer physical and mental health benefits for children
items.summary: A growing body of evidence suggests access to safe, natural areas improves health across a wide variety of areas, including heart health, mental health, weight management, ADHD, and stress among children.

alternate.title: Green schoolyards offer physical and mental health benefits for children

items.title: Girl soccer players who give up other sports may feel more stressed, less rested
items.summary: New research has found sport specialization was associated with significantly worse mood, stress, fatigue, soreness, and sleep quality among female youth soccer players, even after controlling for factors such as age and hours spent training.

alternate.title: Girl soccer players who give up other sports may feel more stressed, less rested
